data.name: Jigsaw 360
data.description:
Relax while completing beautifully detailed spherical jigsaws. The new way to experience a traditional puzzle. Suitable for all ages with between 16 and 200 pieces. Choose from 15 scenes or add your own.

Only possible in VR. Find yourself stood inside the jigsaw. Use your tracked controllers to precisely place your pieces as you build the spherical puzzle. Rotate the jigsaw and scene to see it from different angles or simply walk around the jigsaw. Traditional flat jigsaws are also included.

***What to expect***
Hand tracking support
Auto-save allows you to resume puzzles in progress
Be relaxed by the music
Calmed by the sounds of nature, rain or waves

***Accessibility***
Supports one or two handed play
Optional remote grab and placement of pieces and puzzle
Variable snapping strengths
Play standing, seated or laying down

***Add Photos***
Add custom scenes - thousands freely available online:
Instructions at: https://youtu.be/LeUylWB1ykY

changelog.change_log:
A major bug has been resolved that could lead to pieces getting stuck when dragging them around the tray.

You now only need to hold X / A alone when dragging / dropping pieces around the tray (grip / trigger is not required).

The motion smoothing setting now affects the speed pieces can be dragged around the tray.

While holding the puzzle you can no longer grab it with the other hand without dropping it first. This is to stop accidentally grabbing the puzzle when aligning pieces.

Pieces now need to be a little closer to your hand when grabbing to reduce the chance of accidentally grabbing the wrong piece. Remote grab works as before.

Jigsaws with small pieces will require you to be closer to the target destination before they start to drift into position.

Snapping 3d pieces into place does not require as much precision regarding the angle of pieces when joining them in your hands or when adding to a sphere when the outlines have been hidden.

If you find any issues please report to brett@headstartdesign.co.uk

**Easy custom photo download**
You can now add custom photos directly on Quest via the [download photos] button. This directs you to my website in the Oculus browser where you can download photos (also a link to Flick with thousands more to download). Once downloaded, you can browse to the files from within the game and add them to the photo selection screen.

** Tray improvements**
While holding the X or A buttons you can now drag pieces around the tray or return a grabbed piece to the tray. This means you don’t need to swap between build and arrange modes any more. I’ve also doubled the tray resolution to show more detail in the pieces.

** Usability improvements **
While holding a piece you can now use your thumbstick to move the piece closer or further from your hand. Some people don’t like the pieces being offset from your hand so this should help.
The “lying down mode” has been completely recoded and is now a more versatile “reclining mode”. This allows you to get comfortable in any position and then click a button to realign the tray and puzzle to a suitable angle and position.

I hope you enjoy the game :)

Please report any issues to brett@headstartdesign.co.uk

Following the recent large update I'm tackling a few bugs that crept in.
Fixed bugs that occurred when yaw-locked rotation was disabled in settings menu.
Fixed rotation of jigsaw when game is started and tray is not in the default position.
If you find any issues please report to brett@headstartdesign.co.uk.

** New 200 piece complexity.
** Drag tray to any position.
** 5 new images (and more on the way). 
** New accessibility options (remote placement, remote grab and laying down support).
** Extra space in tray to make room for moving and grouping.
** Custom photos are now ticked and count towards badges just like standard photos.
** Optionally use thumbsticks to rotate the puzzle and pieces.
** Added link to video instructions for adding custom photos.

Removed the elastic "bouncy" feeling on movement of pieces and added a slider in the settings menu to allow you to change the motion smoothing. Turn it up to smooth any hand shake or off to make movement ultra-responsive.
